headline.main: The Frigate Contracts--The President's Health, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary DOBBIN has, at last, finished the award of contracts for the construction of the engines and machinery of the six steam frigates now building for the United States Navy. The contract for the engines of the mons?ership, the Niagara, is awarded to PEASE MURPHY, of the Fulton Ironworks, in New-York City, who will doubtless add not a little, by the execution of this contract, to the excellent reputation they have already achieved.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; Sir Edward Belcher Court-Martialed. The Expedition Against Sitka. IMPEACHMENT OF THE DANISH MINISTRY. THE JAPAN EXPEDITION. FAILURES IN IRELAND. THE CHINESE INSURRECTION. ARRIVAL OF THE PACIFIC. Commercial Embarrassments. SEBASTOPOL NOT TAKEN. NEWS FROM THE CRIMEA--NOTHING. SUBSCRIPTIONS FOR THE WOUNDED. THE BALTIC FLEETS TO RETURN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Pacific, from Liverpool 9 o'clock morning of Wednesday, the 18th, arrived at New-York Monday morning, the 30th. The City of Manchester, from Philadelphia, arrived at Liverpool on the morning of the 14th, after a run of 12 days 13 1/2 hours, mean time.

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the Empire City--Landing of Slaves--Government Proceedings--Miscellaneous Intelligence. &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Empire City H. WINDLE commanding, arrived here this morning. She left New-Orleans the 20th, with the California mails and passengers, and arrived at Havana 23d inst. Landed Havana mails and passengers the same day; 24th, after having transferred the California mails and passengers to the United States Mail steamship Falcon, Capt, A. G. GBAY, bound to Aspinwall, left Havana.
docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamship Empire City H. WINDLE commanding, arrived here this morning. She left New-Orleans the 20th, with the California mails and passengers, and arrived at Havana 23d inst. Landed Havana mails and passengers the same day;...

headline.main: LONG ISLAND.; Navy-Yard affairs. Mortality in Brooklyn. Lecture of Mr. Lynch.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the night watchman in the Navy-Yard, while going his round between 11 and 12 o'clock on Thursday night, discovered a fire in the Oakum loft. The alarm was immediately given, and the fire was quickly extinguished with a few buckets of water. Upon examining the premises, it appeared evident that the fire was set designedly, by an incendiary.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is pleasing to see men who have been known in political life for some years resuming their tastes for domestic enjoyments and private life. The Hards lately nominated AUGUSTUS SCHELL, Esq, for Mayor of this City. Probably they thought, as we did, that Mr SCHELL would not object to an election. Possibly he thought so himself;

docs.lead_paragraph: " Oysters, if you please, waiter ; stews for the ladies, a roast for the boys and, for ourselves, raw, with a bit of lemon." They shall do penance no longer. Pork in gross. Beet is tough. The meats in such weather as this we will not eat, except for wages.
